snippet: Two Republican legislators are running for a rare open State Senate seat and, in the process, each is trying to persuade voters that he is more conservative than his opponent.
lead_paragraph: Three years ago, State Representatives Todd Smith and Kelly Hancock, both Republicans, were on opposite sides of a fight over how to dig the Dallas-Fort Worth area out of gridlock. Now, as the two men vie for a rare open state Senate seat covering portions of Tarrant and Dallas Counties, that disagreement has hardened into a key philosophical divide that supporters on both sides say paints their candidate as the true conservative in the primary race.

headline.main: Two Legislators Strive to Out-Conservative Each Other for a State Senate Seat
